actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 31, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Yakym moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Mr. Guthrie, Mr. Dunn of Florida, Mr. Bergman, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Fitzpatrick and Mr. McCormick.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 71 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives and ranking a Member on a certain standing committee of the House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 70 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 419
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 94).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 500 — "To amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 to postpone the date of payment or satisfaction upon redemption of certain securities in the case of the financial exploitation of specified adults, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 500 and agreeing to the Speaker's Approval of the Journal, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 30.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 p.m. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 298.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McHenry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 298 — "To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to expand access to capital for rural-area small businesses, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 582.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. McHenry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 582 — "To amend the Federal Credit Union Act to modify the frequency of board of directors meetings, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 500.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McHenry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 500 — "To amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 to postpone the date of payment or satisfaction upon redemption of certain securities in the case of the financial exploitation of specified adults, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 342.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Lucas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 342 — "To amend the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to require reporting relating to certain cost-share requirements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 290.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Lucas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 290 — "To provide for transparent licensing of commercial remote sensing systems, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 30.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Alford to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Wilson (SC) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Wilson (SC) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 30.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for  2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
